job_title: Staff Nurse in Frimley, England
pros:
It is a friendly environment with opportunities for growth and learning
International nurses also get maximum support to pass their osce exams. Infact, I could say they are the best when it comes to preparing you for the challenges ahead.
The educational team ( for osce preparation) are very welcoming and you would feel at home the instant you meet with them. The head of the osce preparation team is very selfless. They goes extra length for ALL international recruits. Your chances of passing your osce is 99.99%. I believe, that unit deserves a yearly recognition and pay rise *smiles*. That is how good they are, no sentiments.
cons: Just like every other nhs hospital, the work pressure is high. And the COVID-19 situation is not helping.

review_title: People are great management not so much

job_title: Staff Nurse in Frimley, England
pros: I am a newly qualified nurse at the age of 52. Frimley Park was my Clinical  hospital placement during my 3 years at Surrey University, at all times I felt totally supported by my mentors assigned to me whilst in practice.  I met & worked with  many  amazing healthcare professionals. My preceptorship  programme has  supported me through my transition period from student to staff nurse. I feel totally privileged to be working within a trust that offer every opportunity for you to progress in your career. Everyday I go onto my ward  with a smile on my face as it does not feel like work , I  feel I am going to spend the day with my 2nd family as I work with a great team of health professionals.
cons: The car park is not big enough for the amount of  staff that work at the hospital.

review_title: The Microbiology Laboratory is a terrible place to work
job_title: MLA in Frimley, England
pros:
- Good transport links
- Flexible shift patterns
cons:
- Terrible Management
- Poor progression and training
- Low morale and high staff turnover. 
- Bullying, divided staff, bitchiness and immature people in leadership positions
- There are certain toxic members of staff who operate unchecked by management. Management seem oblivious to the negative effects they have on the lab.
- Poor professionalism in general by management and other staff
- No band 3 positions regardless of employment duration
- The trust has good values which this lab does not uphold or try to embody
Overall: A terrible place to work.

job_title: Maternity Care Assistant in Camberley, England
pros: The team are great, on the whole.
cons: Management are the least helpful, lacking in support, and don't ever recognise the work you doing. They just sit in their offices, and don't interact - top boss doesn't even know staff names a year down the line. Good staff end up leaving, and there are some terrible staff members being taken on, which is quite worrying.

job_title: Care Assistant in Frimley, England
pros: Working in theatres is the best place working at frimley park. Been here for 12 years and we have a very good strong, flexible, reliable and a wonderful team... We are the A team!!!
cons: Well it's nothing new about the shortage of the staff. And that is not new at all. I think when we Merge with Wexham and Heatherwood hospital that is the big impact to Frimley Park. The Work loads is getting more and more and not enough beds for our patients. I think the future of rebuilding Wexham And Heatherwood are going to be very helpful...
